A POLISHED SHINE YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN BEFORE


From a high-end retailer to schools, government buildings and private homes: floors can be functional, environmentally sound and beautiful.

The initial cost for a HTC Superfloor™ is similar to other traditional flooring solutions but low maintenance and durability for a longer life.

HTC Superfloor™ offers more than just a chance to have a hardwearing, high-gloss floor. You can also add a colour of your choice to the concrete floor.

Concrete is made of natural materials, making it the most sustainable floor available. Other coatings and coverings applied to concrete floors can have damaging environmental impacts.

Resistance tests conducted on floor joists and concrete slabs show that HTC Superfloor™ complies with the standard SS-EN 61340-5-1 for ESD (electro-static discharge).

The HTC Twister™ cleaning method allows you to keep all types of floors clean with minimum effort. All that is required is water – no chemicals or polishing agents.

THE FINISH WHICH LEAVES YOU IN AWE




Platinum produces the highest gloss finish and is the concept HTC normally recommends. It involves more grinding stages than the other concepts. The result is an unbeatably durable floor. Truck wheels and substances leave no marks on the glossy surface and light reflects gently off the floor.
Using the Gold concept, you do not grind as deep into the concrete as with Platinum. This means that less aggregate is exposed. Just like the other concepts, Gold then involves polishing the floor with HTC Twister™ to achieve a gloss that is almost as brilliant as a Platinum finish.
The Silver concept is a variation of Platinum. Using this concept, you grind as deep into the concrete as with Platinum, but do not polish it. The aggregate is exposed as with Platinum. Silver is excellent for a floor with a matt surface finish.
Bronze is the concept with the least number of grinding and polishing stages. It does not involve exposing the construction concrete. Instead, the top layer of the surface paste is polished but not removed. This creates a stronger surface paste with a shiny finish.
